comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
This is possibly him in the UK Silver War Badge records:

Name:J. W. Neale
Discharge Unit:Army Service Corps
Rank:2nd Lieut.
Badge Number:341668
Unit:Officers (War Office, London)
Piece:3248
List Number:Piece 3248
Record Group:WO
Record Class:329

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
The London Gazette of 9th April 1918 shows Temporary 2nd Lt J W Neale as relinquishing his commission on account of ill-health contracted while on active service and grants him the honourary rank of 2nd Lt, effective 12th April 1918.

Likely that this is James Wilfred (or Wilfrid) Neale.  There is a James Wilfrid Neale shown as commissioned into the Army Service Corps on 29th July 1917. [LG of 15th August 1917].  It is apparent from the photograph that this officer is probably aged around 40.  A non-specific search suggests that he was possibly from Reigate.//
